quotes.quote: In union there is strength.
He that does good to another does good also to himself.
No man is an island, entire of itself; every man is a piece of the continent.
The path to greatness is along with others.
You can't stay in your corner of the forest waiting for others to come to you. You have to go to them sometimes.
Most great learning happens in groups. Collaboration is the stuff of growth.
Alone we can do so little. Together we can do so much.
In the long history of humankind (and animal kind, too) those who learned to collaborate and improvise most effectively have prevailed.
Many hands make light work.
Sticks in a bundle are unbreakable
We may have all come on different ships, but we're in the same boat now.
If we do not hang together, we will all hang separately.
Now join your hands, and with your hands your hearts.
In walking, the will and the muscles are so accustomed to working together and performing their task with so little expenditure of force that the intellect is left comparatively free.
Let everyone sweep in front of his own door, and the whole world will be clean.
Not in numbers but in unity that our great strength lies.
All things come out of the one, and the one out of all things.
He who cannot help may hinder.
Victory is much more meaningful when it comes not just from one person, but from the joint achievements of many.
A willing helper does not wait until he is asked.
When two people meet, there are really six people present. There is each man as he sees himself, each man as he wants to be seen, and each man as he really is.
So powerful is the light of unity that it can illuminate the whole earth.
Coming together is a beginning, staying together is progress, and working together is success.
The achievements of an organization are the results of the combined effort of each individual.
The strength of the team is each individual member. The strength of each member is the team.
People working together in a strong community with a shared goal and a common purpose can make the impossible possible.
The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.
Only when all contribute their firewood can they build up a strong fire.

Cooperation and conflict are two sides of the same coin; both arise out of man's relationship with his fellows. The larger the group, the greater the possibility of development through cooperation, and the greater the possibility of conflict.
Cooperation is willing collaboration by free individuals in a collective effort that creates more value than it expends.
Take the trouble to stop and think of the other person's feelings, his viewpoints, his desires and needs. Think more of what the other fellow wants, and how he must feel.
Either men will learn to live like brothers, or they will die like beasts.
Union gives strength.
The meeting of two personalities is like the contact of two chemical substances. If there is any reaction, both are transformed.
People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.
Always try to do something for the other fellow and you will be agreeably surprised how things come your way -- how many pleasing things are done for you.
Behold how good and how pleasant it is for brethren to dwell together in unity.
Each of us is here for a brief sojourn; for what purpose he knows not, though he senses it. But without deeper reflection one knows from daily life that one exists for other people.
Everything in the world we want to do or get done, we must do with and through people.
God does notice us, and He watches over us. But it is usually through another person that he meets our needs.

Our lives are like islands in the sea, or like trees in the forest. The maple and the pine may whisper to each other with their leaves ... But the trees also commingle their roots in the darkness underground, and the islands also hang together through the ocean's bottom.
No matter what accomplishments you achieve, somebody helps you.
We are here to awaken from our illusion of separateness.
When we begin to believe that there is greater joy in working with and for others, rather than just for ourselves, then our society will truly become a place of celebration.
You don't get harmony when everybody sings the same note.
Every kind of peaceful cooperation among men is primarily based on mutual trust and only secondarily on institutions such as courts of justice and police

Let's face it. In most of life we really are interdependent. We need each other. Staunch independence is an illusion, but heavy dependence isn't healthy, either. The only position of long-term strength is interdependence: win/win.
The world basically and fundamentally is constituted on the basis of harmony. Everything works in co-operation with something else.
Doing things for others always pays dividends
No man has come to true greatness who has not felt that his life belongs to his race, and that which God gives to him, He gives him for mankind.
Non-cooperation with evil as much a duty as is cooperation with good.
We are born for cooperation, as are the feet, the hands, the eyelids, and the upper and lower jaws.
Getting along with others is the essence of getting ahead, success being linked with cooperation.
Cooperation is not a sentiment—it is an economic necessity.
Save possibly in education effects, cooperation can produce no general results that competition will not produce.
We would rather have one man working with us than working for us.
If you don't believe in cooperation, watch what happens to a wagon when one wheel comes off.
A single arrow is easily broken, but not ten in a bundle.
When spider webs unite, they can tie up a lion.
Government and cooperation are in all things the laws of life; anarchy and competition the laws of death.
With one hand I do not even tie a knot.
God gives food, but does he cook it and put it in the mouth?
You cannot clap with one hand alone.
No more the swindler singly seeks his prey; / To hunt in couples is the modern way / A rascal, from the public to purloin, / An honest man to hide away the coin.

If you lift just a little, I'll pull down from the middle / Combine my dedication with your cooperation / Remove all hesitation with one slight levitation / If you lift just a little, I'll pull down from the middle.
Tryin' hard to weigh up the situation / But without my mind's full cooperation / How can I have something to believe in / When I don't even listen to the mouth the words are leaving.
Cooperation is the thorough conviction that nobody can get there unless everybody gets there.
Nothing truly valuable can be achieved except by the unselfish cooperation of many individuals.
Cooperation doesn't mean agreement, it means working together to advance the greater good.
A hundred thousand men, coming one after another, cannot move a Ton weight; but the united strength of 50 would transport it with ease.
The most effective form of creation is an act of cooperation, not force.
Without trust, there's no cooperation. And without cooperation, there's no progress. History stops.
There is immense power when a group of people with similar interests gets together to work toward the same goals.
An individual can't create anything itself. All of our dreams come true with the cooperation and co-creation of other souls.
We all do better when we work together. Our differences do matter, but our common humanity matters more.
People working together can overcome many obstacles, often within themselves, and by doing so can make the world a better place.
